# PR Summary

#### Issue
Adds #10847

#### Implementation
- Extend the `PSHostUserInterface` class with a `virtual` method `ReadLineMaskedAsString`. This method is in between `ReadLine` and `ReadLineAsSecureString`.
- Implement the new method in the `InternalHostUserInterface.cs`
- I provided a default implementation in the Interface which just throws an exception to make this change backward compatible. 
-  ~~Check at runtime if the user has provided both `-MaskInput` and `-AsSecureString` and if so throw an exception.~~ Use parameter sets to make `-MaskInput` and `-AsSecureString` mutually exclusive (this is another application for #5175)

Happy Hacktoberfest!

comments.author: davinci26
comments.body:
@TravisEz13 if you have any scenario in mind that you might consider risky, I could manually test it or add Pester tests for it.

I personally cant think of any case that this would break but I trust the intuition of the people working on the repo for a lot of time. So if you would like me to explore any scenarios I am more than happy to do it :)
